`MODERATOR_ROLE` to the account that deploys the contract."},"createMultiCreatorPod(string,string,uint256,uint256[],address[])":{"details":"- Pod URI must not exist","params":{"creators":"An array of Pod token creators to receive royalties","royaltyAmount":"The royalty amount to be transfer to the creator","royaltyShares":"An array of royalty amounts to be shared to creators","uri":"The base URI"},"returns":{"podAddress":"The contract address of the Pod token created"}},"createPod(string,string,uint256,address)":{"details":"- Pod URI must not exist","params":{"creator":"The Pod token created"}},"getPodAddressById(string)":{"params":{"podId":"The Pod Id"},"returns":{"podAddress":"The contract address of the Pod token"}},"getPodAddressByUri(string)":{"params":{"uri":"The Pod URI"},"returns":{"podAddress":"The contract address of the Pod token"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"mintPodTokenById(string,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"- The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero","params":{"account":"The destination account to receive minted tokens","amount":"The amount of tokens to be minted","data":"The data to be added (currently not used)","podId":"The Pod Id","tokenId":"The Pod token identifier"}},"mintPodTokenByUri(string,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"- The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero","params":{"account":"The destination account to receive minted tokens","amount":"The amount of tokens to be minted","data":"The data to be added (currently not used)","tokenId":"The Pod token identifier","uri":"The base URI"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. batchMintPodTokenById(string,address,uin.details: - The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero

params.account: The destination account to receive minted tokens
params.amounts: An array of token amounts to be minted
params.data: The data to be added (currently not used)
params.tokenIds: An array of Pod token identifiers

batchMintPodTokenByUri(string,address,ui.details: - The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero

params.account: The destination account to receive minted tokens
params.amounts: An array of token amounts to be minted
params.data: The data to be added (currently not used)
params.tokenIds: An array of Pod token identifiers

constructor.details: Grants `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` and `MODERATOR_ROLE` to the account that deploys the contract.

params.creators: An array of Pod token creators to receive royalties
params.royaltyAmount: The royalty amount to be transfer to the creator
params.royaltyShares: An array of royalty amounts to be shared to creators

returns.podAddress: The contract address of the Pod token created

params.creator: The Pod token creator
params.royaltyAmount: The royalty amount to be transfer to the creator

returns.podAddress: The contract address of the Pod token created

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

mintPodTokenById(string,address,uint256,.details: - The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero

params.account: The destination account to receive minted tokens
params.amount: The amount of tokens to be minted
params.data: The data to be added (currently not used)

mintPodTokenByUri(string,address,uint256.details: - The caller must be MODERATOR_ROLE         - destination address can't be zero         - amount to be minted must be greater than zero

params.account: The destination account to receive minted tokens
params.amount: The amount of tokens to be minted
params.data: The data to be added (currently not used)

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.
